p: Innate immunity is the first line of defense against infectious pathogens, and NLRs, which function as intracellular PRRs, play an important role in resistance to bacterial and viral infection [ 24, 32, 33]. In human [ 17], the deficiency of NOD2 would cause Crohnâ€™s disease and in grass carp [ 24], NOD1 and NOD2 could be upregulated by different immunostimulants. However, almost nothing is known about the homeostatic or pathogen-induced expression patterns of NLR transcripts in mandarinfish.
